Entities.Name: Hormone Receptor Type
Entities.Definition: Refers to the type of hormone receptor (e.g., HER2, estrogen receptor) expressed by the cancer cells.

Sample Data.Sentence: HER2 gene was amplified; estrogen receptor: positive (95%, strong staining); tumor is PR negative (0% staining).
Sample Data.Annotated: Hormone Receptor Type: HER2 amplified, estrogen receptor positive, PR negative

Entities.Name: Tumor Size
Entities.Definition: The physical dimensions of the tumor measured in clinical assessments.

Entities.Name: Tumor Site
Entities.Definition: The specific location within the body or organ where the tumor is located.

Sample Data.Sentence: Tumor is at 12 o’clock position and 2 cm from the nipple.
Sample Data.Annotated: Tumor Site: 12 o’clock position, 2 cm from nipple

Entities.Name: Cancer Grade
Entities.Definition: A classification that describes the aggressiveness of the cancer, often denoted numerically.

Sample Data.Sentence: Histologic grade: 1 of 3; Sample shows Nottingham grade 2 lesions.

Entities.Name: Histological Type
Entities.Definition: The type of tissue from which the cancer originated, as observed under a microscope.

Sample Data.Sentence: Histologic type of invasive carcinoma: ductal carcinoma in situ.
Sample Data.Annotated: Histological Type: ductal carcinoma in situ

Entities.Name: Tumor Laterality
Entities.Definition: Indicates which side of the body the tumor is located, such as left, right, or bilateral.

Sample Data.Sentence: Specimen laterality: right breast; Laterality: left tumor
Sample Data.Annotated: Tumor Laterality: right breast, left tumor

Entities.Name: Cancer Stage
Entities.Definition: The stage of the cancer, which often includes TNM staging to describe the size of the tumor, the degree of spread to the lymph nodes, and the presence of metastasis.

Sample Data.Sentence: Pathologic stage is pT4 NX MX.

Dataset.Name: Breast Cancer Clinical Notes
Dataset.Details: Consists of 200 pathology reports and 50 clinical notes, containing detailed annotations of breast cancer phenotypes.

Annotation Guidelines.Description: Guidelines developed through iterative discussions among clinical experts, utilizing INCEpTION as the annotation tool. Annotations focus on key phenotypes of breast cancer as per clinical reporting standards.
Annotation Guidelines.Link: The guideline document or specific link was not mentioned directly, but more information can be found through the corresponding author or by accessing supplementary materials via the provided DOI link in the reference section.
